page.title: 02Industry
page.content: From 1887 to 1966 the Albion Colliery was the main industry in Cilfynydd.Its closure led to more commuting of workers,some to other collieries but many to manufacturing and service industries closer to Cardiff and the main lines of communication out of South Wales. In the 1980's more local employment was created by reclaiming the old colliery site and building factory units on the land. A survey in 1985 revealed that the new units had many similarities:90% were indepedent of any other company;70% were involved in services such as repairs with only 20% in manufacturing.South Wales was the main market for all of them;80%of them employed less than 10 workers,none more than 50.Good road access was given as the reason for the location.
